Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Can we do a quick session
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also set up another remote session and go through the steps.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.
Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Let’s do the next upgrade together so I don’t miss any steps unless you can give me detailed steps to follow
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1
Let me know if you want me to set a meeting for the upgrade or if you prefer to continue from here on.
Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
The server and agents are backward compatible, so you can have an older server but a newer client, or an older client and a newer server.
The issue with this, is if there are new features, the older one will not know about them so they won't be used.
If I misunderstood your question, please provide more details so I can accurately answer it.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
We did not have many computers that had the issue after we pushed out the client. So if I upgrade the appliance will there be any issues with the clients prior to me pusheing them out?
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown, but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I will wait for the outcome on this one.

After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also set up another remote session and go through the steps.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.
Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1
Let me know if you want me to set a meeting for the upgrade or if you prefer to continue from here on.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
The server and agents are backward compatible, so you can have an older server but a newer client, or an older client and a newer server.
The issue with this, is if there are new features, the older one will not know about them so they won't be used.
If I misunderstood your question, please provide more details so I can accurately answer it.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown, but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I will wait for the outcome on this one.

After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for
restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it
again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer
received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all
computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I
will wait for the outcome on this one.
After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the
server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we
have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content
aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest
version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these
to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also set up another remote session and go through the steps.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1
Let me know if you want me to set a meeting for the upgrade or if you prefer to continue from here on.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting
During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet
Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown,
but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for
restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it
again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer
received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all
computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I
will wait for the outcome on this one.
After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the
server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we
have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content
aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest
version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these
to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Can we do a quick session
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also set up another remote session and go through the steps.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.
Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1
Let me know if you want me to set a meeting for the upgrade or if you prefer to continue from here on.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Can we do a quick session
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also set up another remote session and go through the steps.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.
Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1
Let me know if you want me to set a meeting for the upgrade or if you prefer to continue from here on.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
The server and agents are backward compatible, so you can have an older server but a newer client, or an older client and a newer server.
The issue with this, is if there are new features, the older one will not know about them so they won't be used.
If I misunderstood your question, please provide more details so I can accurately answer it.
Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
We did not have many computers that had the issue after we pushed out the client. So if I upgrade the appliance will there be any issues with the clients prior to me pusheing them out?
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown, but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I will wait for the outcome on this one.

After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a
security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality
upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server
version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a
security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and
go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply
UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System
Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times.
And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me
know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting
During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet
Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown,
but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for
restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it
again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer
received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all
computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I
will wait for the outcome on this one.
After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the
server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we
have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content
aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest
version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these
to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also set up another remote session and go through the steps.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.

Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
The server and agents are backward compatible, so you can have an older server but a newer client, or an older client and a newer server.
The issue with this, is if there are new features, the older one will not know about them so they won't be used.
If I misunderstood your question, please provide more details so I can accurately answer it.

We did not have many computers that had the issue after we pushed out the client. So if I upgrade the appliance will there be any issues with the clients prior to me pusheing them out?
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown, but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I will wait for the outcome on this one.

After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also
set up another remote session and go through the steps.
From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a
security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality
upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server
version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a
security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and
go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply
UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System
Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times.
And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me
know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading

the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.
Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server
with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4
times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting
During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet
Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown,
but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for
restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it
again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer
received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all
computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I
will wait for the outcome on this one.
After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the
server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we
have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content
aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest
version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these
to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown, but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I will wait for the outcome on this one.

After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also
set up another remote session and go through the steps.
From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a
security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality
upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server
version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a
security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and
go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply
UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System
Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times.
And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me
know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting

the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.
Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server
with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4
times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1
Let me know if you want me to set a meeting for the upgrade or if you prefer to continue from here on.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
The server and agents are backward compatible, so you can have an older server but a newer client, or an older client and a newer server.
The issue with this, is if there are new features, the older one will not know about them so they won't be used.
If I misunderstood your question, please provide more details so I can accurately answer it.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown, but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I will wait for the outcome on this one.

After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a

upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server
version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a
security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and
go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply
UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System
Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times.
And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me
know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading

The issue with this, is if there are new features, the older one will not
know about them so they won't be used.

We did not have many computers that had the issue after we pushed out the
client. So if I upgrade the appliance will there be any issues with the
clients prior to me pusheing them out?
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting
During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet
Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown,
but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for
restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it
again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer
received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all
computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I
will wait for the outcome on this one.
After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the
server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we
have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content
aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest
version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these
to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting
During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet
Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown,
but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for
restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it
again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer
received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all
computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I
will wait for the outcome on this one.
After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the
server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we
have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content
aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest
version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these
to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also set up another remote session and go through the steps.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.
Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1
Let me know if you want me to set a meeting for the upgrade or if you prefer to continue from here on.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
I can do both, I can send you a detailed guide, and if you want we can also set up another remote session and go through the steps.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.
Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
Since we have to use the client upgrade feature from the console to upgrade the agent, we need to do it in steps of four versions so as not to exceed the feature's five-version limit.
We need to do this process at least two more times to be up to date.

Alternatively, you can create a new snapshot and then upgrade the server with the functionality upgrade and not the hotfix, but not more than 4 times, then create the upgrade jobs until all agents are upgraded.
Repeat the steps, snapshot included, until you are up to date with server version 5.9.4.1
Let me know if you want me to set a meeting for the upgrade or if you prefer to continue from here on.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
The server and agents are backward compatible, so you can have an older server but a newer client, or an older client and a newer server.
The issue with this, is if there are new features, the older one will not know about them so they won't be used.
If I misunderstood your question, please provide more details so I can accurately answer it.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown, but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I will wait for the outcome on this one.

After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting
During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet
Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown,
but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for
restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it
again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer
received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all
computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I
will wait for the outcome on this one.
After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the
server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we
have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content
aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest
version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these
to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.

From this server version you should see two updates and one of those is a security vulnerability hotfix. We will only use the product functionality upgrades and we can ignore the hotfix since it is contained in server version 5.9.4.0 which is the second-to-last upgrade.
Before upgrading, please make sure you have a snapshot of the VM taken as a security measure in case something happens during the upgrade process.
To upgrade the server using the online option, log into the Web console and go to Dashboard -> Live Update, and click on Check now
After that please select the Product Functionality Update and press Apply UpdatesAfter the update was applied successfully you can refresh the page and the patching is complete.
Keep repeating the process four times, and then you can go to System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade and start a new upgrade job for the agent to the latest version.
Once the agents are upgraded, you can redo the above steps four more times. And so on until there are no more updates found.
If you need us to set up a meeting and go through the steps, just let me know your availability and we can do that.
Please remember to always have a snapshot created before you start upgrading just in case.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]
The server and agents are backward compatible, so you can have an older server but a newer client, or an older client and a newer server.
The issue with this, is if there are new features, the older one will not know about them so they won't be used.
If I misunderstood your question, please provide more details so I can accurately answer it.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #433725 - - Customer is requesting update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0L7i56:ref ]

During our meeting, I saw that the certificate we use for Deep Packet Inspection did not refresh on the computers. The reason is still unknown, but the certificate is used by our local proxy to check all packets for restricted content that might leave the internal network.
As a fix, if we uninstall the agent using the zap tool and then install it again after a reboot, everything is in working order, and the computer received the new certificate from the server.
We also started a client upgrade process from the console so that all computers refresh the certificate and get the latest available agent, and I will wait for the outcome on this one.

After this situation is resolved, my recommendation is to also upgrade the server from version 5.6.0.0 to version 5.9.4.1, which is the latest one we have. There are a lot of improved and new features added to our content aware feature. This also means having to upgrade the agents to the latest version, be it a manual install, using an MDM tool, or GPO.
You mentioned that you will get back to me after you manage to present these to the customer, and I will send you information about GPO deployment.
